title: Data Scientist
description:
Role Title: Data Scientist

Function / Department: Corporate Digitalization and Analytics

Location: Jogeshwari, Mumbai (On-Site) / Chennai (On-Site)




About the Role: We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist (4-6 years) to lead AI-driven transformation in a globally recognized Pharma Manufacturing IIoT environment. Our AI/ML use cases have received recognition from the World Economic Forum's Global Lighthouse Network, making this a high-impact, innovation-driven role.

This position involves leading multiple use cases, working on exploratory technologies, and experimenting with cutting-edge AI tools. The role also entails working on vision-based use cases using quadrupeds (robotic systems) for industrial automation and process optimization.




Why Join Us?

Be part of AI projects recognized by the World Economic Forum's Global Lighthouse Network.
Lead AI-driven decision-making & automation in a high-impact, mission-critical pharma environment.
Experiment with AI innovations & next-gen robotics (quadrupeds, computer vision).
Collaborate with top industry experts in a future-focused, technology-driven environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead AI-Driven Use Cases: Develop and deploy machine learning models for predictive maintenance, yield optimization, and quality control.
Computer Vision & Robotics Integration: Build and optimize vision-based analytics for Quadrupeds to automate inspections and detect anomalies.
Cutting-Edge Generative AI & NLP: Implement Generative AI models (e.g., GANs, Transformers) for manufacturing insights and process automation.
Big Data Processing & AI Pipelines: Work with IIoT data streams, industrial sensors, and unstructured datasets for scalable AI deployment.
Interactive Analytics & Decision Intelligence: Develop high-impact dashboards and visualizations for leadership decision-making.
Research & Experimentation: Explore and implement new AI tools and emerging technologies for digital transformation.




Qualifications:

Education:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a Master's in Statistics, Computer Science, IT, Analytics, or related fields.

Technical Skills:

Programming: Proficiency in Python and libraries such as NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn.
Machine Learning & Deep Learning: Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, and classical ML models.
Computer Vision: Familiarity with OpenCV, object detection models, and industrial vision analytics.
Generative AI: Exposure to GANs, NLP models, and Transformers.
Big Data & IIoT: Experience with data pipelines, ETL processes, and IIoT data streams.
Visualization: Expertise in Tableau, Power BI, or Plotly for interactive dashboards.
Good to have: MLOps, Exposure to Azure or similar cloud platforms




Skills and Competencies:

Strategic Thinker: Ability to drive AI-powered decision-making in a fast-paced industrial setting.
Tech Explorer: Passion for working on emerging AI technologies, robotics, and experimental AI models.
Collaboration & Leadership: Comfortable working with cross-functional teams and leading projects.
Problem-Solving Mindset: Strong analytical skills to handle complex industrial datasets and drive impact.
